20110129060022.000|20110129060023.000|CC1|OF HER SHOES AND GOES AFTER HER 
20110129060023.000|20110129060024.000|CC1|SON.                            
20110129060024.000|20110129060026.000|CC1|>> Reporter: THEN, ACCORDING TO 
20110129060026.000|20110129060027.000|CC1|THE POLICE THEORY, RON WHACKED  
20110129060027.000|20110129060028.000|CC1|HIS MOTHER WITH THE DOORSTOP.   
20110129060028.000|20110129060031.000|CC1|NOW WITH BOTH PARENTS BATTERED

20110129060033.000|20110129060034.000|CC1|INSIDE AND GRABBED TWO KNIVES --
20110129060034.000|20110129060037.000|CC1|THE ONES MISSING FROM THE KNIFE 
20110129060037.000|20110129060038.000|CC1|BLOCK -- AND FINISHED WHAT HE'D 
20110129060038.000|20110129060040.000|CC1|BEGUN.

20110129060048.000|20110129060054.000|CC1|UNBELIEVABLE SITUATION.

20110129060057.000|20110129060058.000|CC1|DETECTIVE'S THEORY, RON JR. THEN
20110129060058.000|20110129060100.000|CC1|DROVE TO THAT NEW HOUSE OF HIS  
20110129060100.000|20110129060101.000|CC1|THAT WAS BEING RENOVATED, WASHED
20110129060101.000|20110129060103.000|CC1|OFF HIS PARENTS' BLOOD AND      
20110129060103.000|20110129060105.000|CC1|REMOVED BLOOD-STAINED CLOTHES.  
20110129060105.000|20110129060106.000|CC1|>> WE KNEW HE HAD A CHANGE OF   
20110129060106.000|20110129060107.000|CC1|CLOTHES THERE THAT HE WOULD USE

20110129060110.000|20110129060112.000|CC1|AND HE GOES HOME.

20110129060121.000|20110129060122.000|CC1|>> Reporter: DETECTIVE STEPHENS 
20110129060122.000|20110129060123.000|CC1|BELIEVES RON JR. THEN RETURNED  
20110129060123.000|20110129060124.000|CC1|TO THE CLOSED GARAGE LATER THAT 
20110129060124.000|20110129060125.000|CC1|NIGHT TO MOP DOWN THE SCENE.    
20110129060125.000|20110129060126.000|CC1|THAT'S WHY THE BLOODY MESSAGE   
20110129060126.000|20110129060126.000|CC1|WAS UNRECOGNIZABLY SMEARED, BUT 
20110129060126.000|20110129060128.000|CC1|MORE IMPORTANTLY, WHY POLICE SAY
20110129060128.000|20110129060132.000|CC1|ALL EVIDENCE AT THE SCENE WAS   
20110129060132.000|20110129060133.000|CC1|WASHED AWAY.                    
20110129060133.000|20110129060135.000|CC1|BUT COULD THEY PROVE IT?        
20110129060135.000|20110129060137.000|CC1|BY NOW IT WAS 2009, NEARLY THREE
20110129060137.000|20110129060139.000|CC1|YEARS SINCE THE MURDERS.        
20110129060139.000|20110129060142.000|CC1|>> WE HAD EXHAUSTED ALL THE     
20110129060142.000|20110129060144.000|CC1|POSSIBILITIES WITH THE STATE    
20110129060144.000|20110129060144.000|CC1|POLICE LAB AND OUR OWN          
20110129060144.000|20110129060148.000|CC1|TECHNICIANS.

20110129060150.000|20110129060151.000|CC1|HOPED TO COME ACROSS, LIKE      
20110129060151.000|20110129060152.000|CC1|FINDING THE KNIVES --           
20110129060152.000|20110129060154.000|CC1|>> YEAH.                        
20110129060154.000|20110129060155.000|CC1|>> FINDING THE DOORSTOP.        
20110129060155.000|20110129060156.000|CC1|>> IT WAS A THIN CASE.          
20110129060156.000|20110129060156.000|CC1|>> IT WAS THIN.                 
20110129060156.000|20110129060157.000|CC1|>> Reporter: AND IT HAD TURNED  
20110129060157.000|20110129060200.000|CC1|COLD.                           
20110129060200.000|20110129060201.000|CC1|>> A COLD CASE IS ONE WHERE     
20110129060201.000|20110129060204.000|CC1|THERE ARE NO NEW LEADS.         
20110129060204.000|20110129060205.000|CC1|>> Reporter: WHICH WAS STEVE    
20110129060205.000|20110129060206.000|CC1|KAPLAN'S CALLING CARD.          
20110129060206.000|20110129060207.000|CC1|A TOP PROSECUTOR, KAPLAN WAS    
20110129060207.000|20110129060209.000|CC1|POINT MAN FOR THE MACOMB COUNTY 
20110129060209.000|20110129060211.000|CC1|COLD CASE UNIT THAT SPECIALIZED 
20110129060211.000|20110129060212.000|CC1|IN UNDERDOG CASES.              
20110129060212.000|20110129060213.000|CC1|>> NONE OF OUR CASES WERE SOLVED
20110129060213.000|20110129060215.000|CC1|THROUGH FORENSIC EVIDENCE.      
20110129060215.000|20110129060217.000|CC1|ALL THE COLD CASES RELATED TO   
20110129060217.000|20110129060218.000|CC1|THE OLD-FASHIONED SHOE LEATHER. 
20110129060218.000|20110129060219.000|CC1|>> Reporter: FRESH EYES, NEW    
20110129060219.000|20110129060219.000|CC1|APPROACH.                       
20110129060219.000|20110129060220.000|CC1|>> EXACTLY.                     
20110129060220.000|20110129060222.000|CC1|>> Reporter: KAPLAN HAD TAKEN ON
20110129060222.000|20110129060224.000|CC1|25 COLD CASES AND WAS           
20110129060224.000|20110129060225.000|CC1|UNDEFEATED, GAINING EITHER      
20110129060225.000|20110129060228.000|CC1|CONVICTIONS OR GUILTY PLEAS.    
20110129060228.000|20110129060230.000|CC1|WAS NUMBER 26 IN THE CARDS?     
20110129060230.000|20110129060236.000|CC1|KAPLAN MET WITH DETECTIVE       
20110129060236.000|20110129060237.000|CC1|STEPHENS AND OTHER INVESTIGATORS
20110129060237.000|20110129060237.000|CC1|AT THIS STATE POLICE POST, WHERE
20110129060237.000|20110129060239.000|CC1|A WAR ROOM WAS SET UP WITH      
20110129060239.000|20110129060239.000|CC1|STACKS OF FILES, INTERVIEWS AND 
20110129060239.000|20110129060240.000|CC1|VISUAL DISPLAYS.                
20110129060240.000|20110129060241.000|CC1|>> AND WE GO OVER THE ENTIRE    
20110129060241.000|20110129060245.000|CC1|CASE FROM START TO FINISH.      
20110129060245.000|20110129060246.000|CC1|>> WE CONCLUDED THAT WE HAD THE 
20110129060246.000|20110129060247.000|CC1|RIGHT SUSPECT.                  
20110129060247.000|20110129060248.000|CC1|ALL THE LEADS HAD BEEN          
20110129060248.000|20110129060248.000|CC1|EXHAUSTED.                      
20110129060248.000|20110129060249.000|CC1|THE CASE WOULD NOT HAVE IMPROVED
20110129060249.000|20110129060249.000|CC1|OVER TIME.                      
20110129060249.000|20110129060251.000|CC1|>> Reporter: BUT KAPLAN ALSO    
20110129060251.000|20110129060253.000|CC1|KNEW THE CASE HAD SERIOUS FLAWS,
20110129060253.000|20110129060255.000|CC1|THE LACK OF ANY PHYSICAL

20110129060259.000|20110129060300.000|CC1|THE COUNTY'S REGULAR CHARGING

20110129060644.000|20110129060645.000|CC1|4 YEARS AFTER THE SLAUGHTER OF  
20110129060645.000|20110129060645.000|CC1|RON AND CHRISTINE JABALEE IN    
20110129060645.000|20110129060650.000|CC1|THEIR GARAGE, THEIR SON,        
20110129060650.000|20110129060651.000|CC1|RON JR., FACED FIRST-DEGREE     
20110129060651.000|20110129060652.000|CC1|MURDER CHARGES IN A MACOMB      
20110129060652.000|20110129060655.000|CC1|COUNTY, MICHIGAN, COURTROOM.    
20110129060655.000|20110129060656.000|CC1|PROSECUTOR STEVE KAPLAN,        
20110129060656.000|20110129060657.000|CC1|UNDEFEATED IN PREVIOUS COLD     
20110129060657.000|20110129060659.000|CC1|CASES, TOLD JURORS THAT THE     
20110129060659.000|20110129060701.000|CC1|MURDERS WERE PERSONAL IN NATURE,
20110129060701.000|20110129060703.000|CC1|AND THE DEFENDANT, A BUTCHER BY 
20110129060703.000|20110129060709.000|CC1|TRADE, COMMITTED THE CRIMES.    
20110129060709.000|20110129060710.000|CC1|>> WHOEVER DID THIS, 24 STAB    
20110129060710.000|20110129060711.000|CC1|WOUNDS, TO TWO PEOPLE, AT LEAST,
20110129060711.000|20110129060713.000|CC1|TO THE FACE, TO THE CHEST, WAS  
20110129060713.000|20110129060714.000|CC1|DONE BY SOMEBODY WHO KNOWS HOW  
20110129060714.000|20110129060715.000|CC1|TO USE A KNIFE.                 
20110129060715.000|20110129060716.000|CC1|>> Reporter: WHAT WAS THE       
20110129060716.000|20110129060717.000|CC1|STRONGEST HAND YOU WERE HOLDING?
20110129060717.000|20110129060718.000|CC1|WHAT WAS THE BEST BIT OF        
20110129060718.000|20110129060720.000|CC1|EVIDENCE YOU HAD?               
20110129060720.000|20110129060720.000|CC1|>> RON JABALEE'S STATEMENTS,    
20110129060720.000|20110129060722.000|CC1|WHICH ARE DAMNING AND           
20110129060722.000|20110129060725.000|CC1|INCRIMINATING AND WOULD NOT HAVE
20110129060725.000|20110129060726.000|CC1|BEEN UTTERED BY A PERSON WHO HAD
20110129060726.000|20110129060728.000|CC1|NOT BEEN THE KILLER.            
20110129060728.000|20110129060729.000|CC1|>> Reporter: HE MADE ONE OF     
20110129060729.000|20110129060730.000|CC1|THOSE STATEMENTS TO HIS UNCLE   
20110129060730.000|20110129060731.000|CC1|RONALD EIGHT DAYS AFTER THE     
20110129060731.000|20110129060732.000|CC1|MURDERS.                        
20110129060732.000|20110129060733.000|CC1|>> HE SAID, "MAYBE I DID IT.    
20110129060733.000|20110129060735.000|CC1|I DON'T KNOW."                  
20110129060735.000|20110129060737.000|CC1|>> AND YOU SAID YOU WERE SHOCKED

20110129060739.000|20110129060740.000|CC1|>> I WAS SHOCKED. YES.          
20110129060740.000|20110129060745.000|CC1|>> THANK YOU, SIR.              
20110129060745.000|20110129060747.000|CC1|>> JOSEPH M. POLITO.            
20110129060747.000|20110129060748.000|CC1|>> Reporter: ANOTHER UNCLE,     
20110129060748.000|20110129060748.000|CC1|JOE POLITO, IN A SEPARATE       
20110129060748.000|20110129060749.000|CC1|CONVERSATION THAT SAME DAY,     
20110129060749.000|20110129060750.000|CC1|HEARD RON SAY SOMETHING SIMILAR.
20110129060750.000|20110129060751.000|CC1|>> HE SAID HE THOUGHT HE MAY    
20110129060751.000|20110129060753.000|CC1|HAVE DID IT AND DOESN'T KNOW IT,
20110129060753.000|20110129060755.000|CC1|OR WORDS TO THAT EFFECT.        
20110129060755.000|20110129060757.000|CC1|>> NOW, WHO IN THIS WORLD MADE  
20110129060757.000|20110129060759.000|CC1|STATEMENTS TO YOU THAT HE MIGHT 
20110129060759.000|20110129060800.000|CC1|HAVE COMMITTED THESE MURDERS, HE
20110129060800.000|20110129060801.000|CC1|DOESN'T REMEMBER?

20110129060832.000|20110129060833.000|CC1|>> Reporter: WHILE HE LISTENED  
20110129060833.000|20110129060836.000|CC1|TO THE TESTIMONY, WITHOUT       
20110129060836.000|20110129060837.000|CC1|EMOTION, RON JABALEE JR. CAME

20110129060900.000|20110129060901.000|CC1|TESTIFIED HE FELT THREATENED BY 
20110129060901.000|20110129060903.000|CC1|RON JR. OVER THE PHONE BECAUSE  
20110129060903.000|20110129060904.000|CC1|ED GONE BEFORE THE GRAND JURY IN
20110129060904.000|20110129060906.000|CC1|THIS CASE.                      
20110129060906.000|20110129060907.000|CC1|>> WHAT MADE YOU FEEL

20110129060913.000|20110129060916.000|CC1|ANYTHING, HE WOULD DO IF THE

20110129061540.000|20110129061541.000|CC1|>> Reporter: TOUGH CASE, MISSING

20110129062102.000|20110129062104.000|CC1|ON AT 11:30 AND THEN OFF AROUND 
20110129062104.000|20110129062105.000|CC1|1:30 IN THE MORNING,            
20110129062105.000|20110129062106.000|CC1|SURPRISINGLY LATE FOR HABITUAL  
20110129062106.000|20110129062109.000|CC1|EARLY RISERS.                   
20110129062109.000|20110129062110.000|CC1|DETECTIVE STEVENS BELIEVED THE  
20110129062110.000|20110129062110.000|CC1|MURDERER CAME BACK TO THE       
20110129062110.000|20110129062113.000|CC1|GARAGE.                         
20110129062113.000|20110129062114.000|CC1|>> NOW, AS A DETECTIVE, WHY     
20110129062114.000|20110129062115.000|CC1|WOULD A KILLER RETURN TO A      
20110129062115.000|20110129062117.000|CC1|SCENE?                          
20110129062117.000|20110129062122.000|CC1|>> IT COULD BE THAT HE OR SHE   
20110129062122.000|20110129062124.000|CC1|FORGOT TO DO SOMETHING SUCH AS  
20110129062124.000|20110129062125.000|CC1|TURNING OFF THE LIGHTS OR LEFT  
20110129062125.000|20110129062126.000|CC1|SOMETHING AT THE SCENE.         
20110129062126.000|20110129062127.000|CC1|>> Reporter: POLICE BELIEVE THE 
20110129062127.000|20110129062130.000|CC1|DEFENDANT LEFT EVIDENCE THAT    
20110129062130.000|20110129062131.000|CC1|NEEDED TO BE WASHED CLEAN, THE  
20110129062131.000|20110129062132.000|CC1|SAME WAY A BUTCHER SHOP GETS    
20110129062132.000|20110129062135.000|CC1|HOSED DOWN EVERY NIGHT.         
20110129062135.000|20110129062136.000|CC1|IN HIS TESTIMONY, STEVENS MADE  
20110129062136.000|20110129062138.000|CC1|MENTION OF ONE SECTION OF THE   
20110129062138.000|20110129062139.000|CC1|GARAGE THAT STILL PUZZLED HIM.  
20110129062139.000|20110129062141.000|CC1|>> THERE WAS A PORTION OF THE   
20110129062141.000|20110129062141.000|CC1|GARAGE FLOOR THAT I BELIEVE WAS 
20110129062141.000|20110129062142.000|CC1|MOPPED UP.                      
20110129062142.000|20110129062145.000|CC1|IT WOULD HAVE BEEN THE AREA     
20110129062145.000|20110129062146.000|CC1|UNDERNEATH THE REAR OF THE JEEP.
20110129062146.000|20110129062147.000|CC1|>> Reporter: THAT'S WHERE THOSE 
20110129062147.000|20110129062150.000|CC1|BLOODY LETTERS WERE,            
20110129062150.000|20110129062150.000|CC1|INDECIPHERABLE BECAUSE THEY'D   
20110129062150.000|20110129062152.000|CC1|BEEN MOPPED UP.                 
20110129062152.000|20110129062155.000|CC1|>> YOU COULD SEE THAT WATER HAD 
20110129062155.000|20110129062158.000|CC1|BEEN WIPED THROUGH THIS MESSAGE,
20110129062158.000|20110129062159.000|CC1|AND THE MESSAGE DESTROYED.      
20110129062159.000|20110129062200.000|CC1|>> Reporter: STEVENS TOLD THE   
20110129062200.000|20110129062202.000|CC1|JURY THAT A SLAB OF GARAGE WAS  
20110129062202.000|20110129062203.000|CC1|SENT TO THE CRIME LAB FOR       
20110129062203.000|20110129062205.000|CC1|ANALYSIS, BUT EXPERTS THERE     
20110129062205.000|20110129062206.000|CC1|COULDN'T MAKE HEADS OR TAILS OF 
20110129062206.000|20110129062207.000|CC1|IT, EITHER.                     
20110129062207.000|20110129062209.000|CC1|>> THERE'S ALSO EVIDENCE AT THE 
20110129062209.000|20110129062211.000|CC1|SCENE SUGGESTING A CLEAN-UP WITH
20110129062211.000|20110129062212.000|CC1|A MOP, SO BLOOD HAD BEEN MOPPED 
20110129062212.000|20110129062214.000|CC1|UP FROM THE GARAGE FLOOR.       
20110129062214.000|20110129062216.000|CC1|>> Reporter: AND TIDILY REPLACED
20110129062216.000|20110129062216.000|CC1|IN THE GARAGE IN THE PLACE WHERE
20110129062216.000|20110129062217.000|CC1|THE MOP AND --                  
20110129062217.000|20110129062218.000|CC1|>> RIGHT.                       
20110129062218.000|20110129062218.000|CC1|>> Reporter: -- BUCKET ALWAYS   
20110129062218.000|20110129062219.000|CC1|WERE.                           
20110129062219.000|20110129062220.000|CC1|>> THE MOP WAS RETURNED TO ITS  
20110129062220.000|20110129062221.000|CC1|PLACE.                          
20110129062221.000|20110129062224.000|CC1|AND MR. JABALEE, THE VICTIM, WAS
20110129062224.000|20110129062225.000|CC1|VERY REGIMENTED, AND HE         
20110129062225.000|20110129062226.000|CC1|INSTILLED THAT REGIMENTATION

20110129062241.000|20110129062244.000|CC1|TELL 15 PEOPLE OVER A 2 1/2-YEAR

20110129062245.000|20110129062247.000|CC1|WHETHER HE KILLED HIS PARENTS.  
20110129062247.000|20110129062248.000|CC1|>> Reporter: RON DID SEVERAL

20110129062249.000|20110129062251.000|CC1|KAPLAN PICKED THE ONE HE THOUGHT
20110129062251.000|20110129062253.000|CC1|WAS MOST CONCISE.               
20110129062253.000|20110129062254.000|CC1|STATE DETECTIVE PAT YOUNG       
20110129062254.000|20110129062255.000|CC1|CONDUCTED IT 18 MONTHS AFTER THE
20110129062255.000|20110129062256.000|CC1|MURDERS.

20110129062301.000|20110129062302.000|CC1|VICODIN.

20110129063047.000|20110129063048.000|CC1|>> NOW, YOU INDICATED --        
20110129063048.000|20110129063048.000|CC1|>> Reporter: IF THERE WAS       
20110129063048.000|20110129063049.000|CC1|ANOTHER WAY TO LOOK AT RON'S

20110129064540.000|20110129064541.000|CC1|>> AND THEN YOU QUALIFIED IT
